title: Interpreting $r$: Studying in College
question_text:
A college professor examined the hours per week that a student studied and the number of tests that the student has failed in his college career. The regression equation is as follows:
$$\text{Tests failed}= 15.6-0.802 \times \text{hours studied}$$
$S = 6.29484$ $r^2 = 29.2\%$ $r^2\text{(adjusted)} = 22.8\%$
What is a valid interpretation of the correlation coefficient, $r$?
solution:
Since the slope is negative, the correlation must be negative.

Also, if $r^2$ is $0.292$, then $r = -0.54$. This is considered a moderate correlation, as any value between $\pm 0.3$ and $\pm 0.7$ will be considered moderate.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'D'.
